citation.article-title: Hyphomicrobium chloromethanicum sp. nov. and Methylobacterium chloromethanicum sp. nov., chloromethane-utilizing bacteria isolated from a polluted environment.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Hyphomicrobium chloromethanicum sp. nov.
Gram-negative, monoprosthecate rods having buds on the prosthecal tips.
Cells are 0.5-0.6 μm in diameter and 1.3-1.8 μm long.
Grows on chloromethane, methanol, methylamine and ethanol as sole carbon and energy sources.
C1-compound assimilation is via the serine pathway, the major quinone is Q9 and the main fatty acid is C18:1.
The optimum temperature for growth is 28-30 °C.
The optimum pH for growth is 6.5-7.5.
The G+­C content of DNA is 60.0 mol%. H. chloromethanicum has 29.4% DNA-DNA hybridization to H. zavarzinii ZV-622T (ATCC 27496).

The GenBank accession number for the 16S rRNA gene sequence of strain CM2T is AF198623. H. chloromethanicum strain CM2T was isolated from soil at the Nizhekamsk petrochemical factory, Tatarstan, Russia.
The type strain is strain CM2T and is deposited in the All-Russian Collection of Microorganisms as VKMB-2176T, and the National Collections of Industrial, Food and Marine Bacteria as NCIMB 13687T.
